snippet: After many years and billions of dollars of research, hydrogen cars are joining electric cars in showrooms, and advocates will likely spar over which is more practical.
abstract: Automobiles fueled by hydrogen, espoused by Pres George W Bush in 2003, are headed to showrooms after years of research and billions of dollars in development; cars will likely stoke debate over whether hydrogen-fueled or electric battery-powered vehicles are more practical means of meeting energy needs while reducing carbon footprint.
lead_paragraph: After many years and billions of dollars of research, hydrogen cars are joining electric cars in showrooms, and advocates will likely spar over which is more practical.

headline.seo: Hydrogen Cars Join Electric Models in Showrooms
headline.main: A Road Test of Alternative Fuel Visions
headline.print_headline: A Road Test of Alternative Fuel Visions
